source:
Drag and drop your rolls onto ability score cells,
or optimize them for your character class.
Adjust your ability scores from your points pool.
Adjust your ability scores as desired.
You cannot lower this value any more.
Raise this ability score at the cost of {0} point(s).
Choose an ability generation system and define your character's stats.
Optimize ability score assignments for the selected character class.
Reroll 6 ability scores, using 4d6 and keeping the three best rolls.
You have this many points still to spend.
Reroll 6 ability scores, using 4d6 and keeping the three best rolls.
Generate the character's six main ability scores.
You must assign all 6 ability scores to the left side of the screen.
You must spend all your points before you can proceed.
You must spend all the ability score points from leveling up.
You must spend all the ability score points from the chosen ancestry.
As a "{0}", your most important ability scores are {1}, {2}, and {3}.

As a member of the "{0}" class, you have access to all spells (except cantrips) of your spell list.

Another interface will let you choose spells to prepare for the day.
Show the features granted at higher levels.
This stage creates a background for the character.
You must choose two additional personality flags on the ethical board (Law/Chaos/Good/Evil).
You must choose personality flags for your selected background.
Click to choose between different equipment configurations.
This stage lets you level up a class or add a new class.
This stage lets you choose class features for your character.
This stage lets you choose which deity the character follows, and select the benefits of your faith.
You must select a divine domain.
This stage lets you choose a fighting style for the character.
You must select a fighting style.

You have gained {0} hit points

You have gained one additional hit die

You have gained {0} hit point

You have gained one additional hit die
This stage develops the character's background.
Another character is already using that name.
Creates a random name based on the character's ancestry.
This stage lists what you have gained from your new level.
Let the computer make the choices for now.

Increased to {0}
Affects all attacks, saving throws, skill & tool checks, and spell DC.
Go back on proficiency step and make changes.

Proficiency in a saving throw, skill, tool, or weapon lets you add your proficiency bonus to the corresponding ability check. Proficiency in feats, languages, and armors lets you use them. Expertise in skills and tools doubles the proficiency bonus.
Choose {0} trained skills or {1} to become expert in (double proficiency)
Choose {0} trained skills or {1} to become expert in (double proficiency)
Your ancestry, class, and background let you choose proficiencies in skills, tools, feats, and languages.
Gaining a level gives you new proficiencies to choose.
Reset allocated proficiency points for this step.
This stage chooses the character's proficiencies: skills, expertise, languages, and more.
You must spend all your proficiency points before proceeding.
This stage determines the character's ancestry and its features.
Select {0} spells to scribe into your spellbook.
Select a spell to scribe into your spellbook.
This stage allows you to choose the character's spells.
You must learn all your spells before proceeding.
This stages chooses a martial archetype for the character.
You must select a martial archetype.
This stage chooses the character's sacred oath.
You must select a sacred oath.
This stages selects the character's ranger archetype.
You must select a ranger archetype.
This stage selects the character's roguish archetype.
You must select a roguish archetype.
This stages selects the character's subclass.
This stages selects the character's arcane tradition.
You must select an arcane tradition.
Select new spells or cantrips to learn.
A character must have a minimum strength of {0} to start adventuring.
None of your spellbooks contains enough room to scribe these spells. You must acquire a new spellbook to complete the level up sequence.
This stage chooses a sorcerous origin for the character
This stage chooses a sorcerous origin for the character
You must select a sorcerous origin.
This stage chooses a primal path for the character
This stage chooses a druid circle for the character
